snippet: The politically connected state sector may threaten China’s economy and political stability, but it is unclear whether leaders will take action.
abstract: Many Chinese economists worry that country's state sector threatens to choke China's economic growth and even damage its political stability; for all the talk about extent to which China has embraced capitalism, huge sectors of economy dominated by country's 145,000 state-owned enterprises still have not fully done so. (Series: Changing of the Guard)
lead_paragraph: The politically connected state sector may threaten China’s economy and political stability, but it is unclear whether leaders will take action.

headline.seo: State Enterprises Pose Test for China’s New Leaders
headline.main: China’s Grip on Economy Will Test New Leaders
headline.print_headline: China’s Grip On Economy Will Test New Leaders
